content.user_title: Write Scientific Manuscripts with IMRAD Structure
content.value_statement: This skill guides the creation of publication-ready scientific manuscripts. It provides structured approaches for IMRAD format, proper citation styles, figure and table guidelines, and compliance with reporting standards like CONSORT, STROBE, and PRISMA.
actual_capabilities: Guide papers through Introduction, Methods, Results, and Discussion (IMRAD) structure
Apply citation styles including APA, AMA, Vancouver, Chicago, and IEEE
Create figures and tables following publication-quality standards
Ensure compliance with reporting guidelines (CONSORT, STROBE, PRISMA)
Format abstracts and manuscripts according to journal requirements
Write in full paragraphs using two-stage process from outline to prose
limitations: Does not perform actual literature searches (requires research-lookup skill)
Does not generate or analyze experimental data
Does not submit manuscripts to journals or interact with submission systems
Does not verify citation accuracy against original sources

prompt_templates.title: Basic Manuscript Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write the Introduction section for a research paper about [topic]. Use IMRAD structure and include guidance on establishing research context and identifying knowledge gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Citation Formatting
prompt_templates.prompt: Format these references in [APA/AMA/Vancouver] style: [list of citations]. Show me the in-text citation format and reference list entry for each.

prompt_templates.title: Reporting Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my [CONSORT/STROBE/PRISMA] checklist and help me ensure my [randomized trial/observational study/systematic review] manuscript includes all required elements.

prompt_templates.title: Full Manuscript
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write a complete research paper on [topic] using IMRAD structure. Start by creating an outline with key points, then expand each section into flowing prose paragraphs. Include placeholder citations and figure references.

output_examples.input: Help me write the Introduction for a paper about AI in drug discovery
output: The Introduction will follow IMRAD structure with four key components:
‚Ä¢ Background: AI applications in drug discovery gaining traction (cite recent reviews)
‚Ä¢ Knowledge Gap: Limited application to rare diseases (cite 2-3 prior studies)
‚Ä¢ Study Objectives: Validate transfer learning approach on rare disease datasets
‚Ä¢ Key transitions: Connect background to gap, gap to approach, approach to objectives

best_practices: Always write in full paragraphs with flowing prose - never submit bullet points in the final manuscript
Use the two-stage process: create outlines with research-lookup first, then convert to complete paragraphs
Follow journal-specific author guidelines for formatting, word limits, and section requirements
Include comprehensive citations from primary sources published within the last 5-10 years
anti_patterns: Leaving bullet points in the final manuscript instead of converting to prose
Using the same citation style inconsistently throughout the document
Overloading with jargon without defining specialized terms for the target audience
Skipping reporting guidelines when applicable to your study type

faq.question: What citation styles are supported?
faq.answer: APA, AMA, Vancouver, Chicago, IEEE, ACS, and NLM styles are supported. Choose based on your target journal's requirements.

faq.question: What is the two-stage writing process?
faq.answer: Stage 1: Create outlines with bullet points using research-lookup. Stage 2: Convert outlines to full prose paragraphs.

faq.question: Which reporting guidelines apply to my study?
faq.answer: CONSORT for trials, STROBE for observational studies, PRISMA for reviews, STARD for diagnostics, ARRIVE for animal research.

faq.question: How many figures should a paper include?
faq.answer: Minimum 5-6 figures for research papers: graphical abstract, methods flowchart, results visualizations, and conceptual diagrams.

faq.question: Does this skill search for literature?
faq.answer: No, this skill focuses on writing. Use the research-lookup skill for literature searches, then apply this skill for writing.

faq.question: Can this skill format for specific journals?
faq.answer: This skill provides general scientific writing. Use the venue-templates skill for journal-specific formatting and style guides.
